ygData.subject: Re: More on the Plane of Fear
ygData.msgSnippet: I think what would be better if it could be done is have the gate setup to where you HAVE to be a certin Lvl to get in, say you should be lvl 35 to get in if
ygData.messageBody:
I think what would be better if it could be done is have the gate setup to
where you HAVE to be a certin Lvl to get in, say you should be lvl 35 to get
in if you're not at least Lvl 35 the gate kicks you back out. Plus if this
Plane of Fear is suppose to be so hard then why not have the zone before it
harder so these low lvl players can't even get close to it?

**************************
Azor
Lvl 18 Human Cleric of the Rathe
**************************

> From: Jeff Meakins <Jeff_Meakins@...>
>
> And if the gate damage had been in the game from day one, would there be
> complaints? I say far less...
> Should all of Norrath be available to every player from the get go? I say
> no...
>
> Hill giants and griffins kill low levels too...but we have accepted that
as
> part of the game. If the damage gate had been there from day one, it
would
> have been more along the lines of "Cool! You can't even gate there and
> survive until you are level xx!"
>
> Brad stated the Plane of Fear was supposed to be hard, in the context of
> hard for very high level characters.
> May seem elitist, but I think the high level players will probably
> appreciate this more than hate it...keeping the lower levels out so they
can
> focus on themselves and not having to save newbies that just wander in to
> the Plane of Fear. And how does that sound? "I just wandered in to the
> Plane of Fear...ho hum."
>
> And it also proves to be an achievement of sorts, being able to warp into
> the Plane of Fear and survive the shock that would kill the average
person.
> I am all for a Plane that causes damage when you enter it...makes it more
> ominous and harsh! Is the Plane of Fear supposed to be a cake walk?
>
> This is not a flame, I am just stating a counterpoint.
